code: @Manual{,   title = {graphvec: Vectorised graph data structures},   author = {Mitchell O'Hara-Wild},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Vectorised graph data structures
text: graphvec package extends vectors include graph relationships unique values, offers tools compute useful summaries graph structure use summarising, filtering, otherwise manipulating graph.

title: Vectorised graph data structures
text: can install development version graphvec GitHub :

title: Vectorised graph data structures
text: agg_vec() (aggregation vector) defines simple hierarchical graph structure single parent node. node_vec() defines general graph structure nodes can multiple parents children. vectors particularly useful used rectangular tidy data structures. transpose node vector edge_vec(), instead vectorised along edges graph. node_vec() edge_vec() can converted igraph objects analysis. Direct vectorised statistics operations vectors planned package future releases.
code: library(graphvec) agg_vec(   x = c(NA, "A", "B"),   aggregated = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE) ) #> <agg_vec[3]> #> [1] <aggregated> A            B library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union g <- node_vec(   x = factor(c("A", "B", "C", "D", "D", "E")),   edges = tibble(     from = list(c(1L, 3L), c(2L, 4L)),     to = c(2L, 5L)   ) )  g #> <node_vec[6]> #> [1] A B C D D E x <- tibble(g, y = rnorm(6))  x #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>         g       y #>   <nodes>   <dbl> #> 1       A -1.82   #> 2       B -0.0199 #> 3       C  0.933  #> 4       D  0.247  #> 5       D -2.20   #> 6       E  0.824 e <- edge_vec(   from = c(1L, 2L, 1L, 3L),   to = c(2L, 3L, 3L, 1L),   nodes = data.frame(     id = 1:3,     label = c("A", "B", "C")   ) )  e #> <edge_vec[4]> #> [1] [1:A]->[2:B] [2:B]->[3:C] [1:A]->[3:C] [3:C]->[1:A] igraph::as.igraph(g) #> IGRAPH f826c4e D--- 5 4 --  #> + edges from f826c4e: #> [1] 1->2 3->2 2->5 4->5 igraph::as.igraph(e) #> IGRAPH 0638902 D--- 3 4 --  #> + edges from 0638902: #> [1] 1->2 2->3 1->3 3->1

title: Create an aggregation vector — agg_vec
text: aggregation vector special type node_vec() consisting single parent ('aggregated' value) children. Aggregated values identified logical vector passed aggregated argument, disaggregated values provided x. Aggregated values displayed <aggregated> default.

title: Create an aggregation vector — agg_vec
code: agg_vec(   x = c(NA, "A", "B"),   aggregated = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE) ) #> <agg_vec[3]> #> [1] <aggregated> A            B

title: Graph vector along edges — edge_vec
code: g <- edge_vec(   from = c(1L, 2L, 1L, 3L),   to = c(2L, 3L, 3L, 1L),   nodes = data.frame(     id = 1:3,     label = c("A", "B", "C")   ) )  # Access node data via `$` g$from$label #> [1] "A" "B" "A" "C" g$to$label #> [1] "B" "C" "C" "A"
